docs.abstract: The literary figure is the glowing subject of a group exhibition, curated by the New Yorker critic Hilton Als, that is part personal narrative, part study of his influence on contemporary artists.
docs.snippet: The literary figure is the glowing subject of a group exhibition, curated by the New Yorker critic Hilton Als, that is part personal narrative, part study of his influence on contemporary artists.
docs.lead_paragraph: “My father said, during all the years I lived with him, that I was the ugliest boy he had ever seen, and I had absolutely no reason to doubt him.” So wrote James Baldwin in 1976, and he repeated his father’s words often. He did have reason to doubt them though. They didn’t jibe with my impression of the writer’s appearance as taken from a photograph on the cover of the 1955 paperback edition of “Notes of a Native Son,” which I owned and treasured when I was a teenager, and a copy of which you’ll find on display toward the start of the exhibition “God Made My Face: A Collective Portrait of James Baldwin” at David Zwirner.

headline.print_headline: Under the Influence of James Baldwin

docs.abstract: Shaken by the assault on Jan. 6, about 1,000 congressional aides, mostly people of color, have joined forces to press for changes in their workplace. It is the closest they can get to a union.

docs.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — Please help me welcome back the constructor Kyle Dolan, and congratulations to him for hitting for the cycle, which means that he now has a puzzle published in The New York Times for each day of the week.

docs.abstract: A philosophical and moral conversion led this Marine to leave the military. Why don't more take this path?
docs.snippet: A philosophical and moral conversion led this Marine to leave the military. Why don't more take this path?
docs.lead_paragraph: It was a book of Buddhist parables that put Michael Rasmussen over the edge. In March 2017, Mr. Rasmussen was living near a naval base in Japan, six years into training as a Marine pilot, reading and experimenting with meditation.

docs.abstract: Bright colors are a hallmark of the Japanese artist’s creations, but in this case he chose black. With diamonds.
docs.snippet: Bright colors are a hallmark of the Japanese artist’s creations, but in this case he chose black. With diamonds.
docs.lead_paragraph: After collaborating on timepieces with brands like Louis Vuitton and Casio G-Shock, the Japanese artist Takashi Murakami wasn’t interested, at least initially, in creating a watch for Hublot.

headline.main: Takashi Murakami’s Smiling Flower Becomes a Hublot Watch

docs.abstract: “Family Matters” at the ICP captures the inevitability of families fractured over politics.
docs.snippet: “Family Matters” at the ICP captures the inevitability of families fractured over politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: Someone has left in a hurry. The signs are there in the photograph: the open drawers, the improperly rolled tissue paper, the white electric cable peeking out from underneath the counter. The walls and floors are covered with marble — reflecting light, intensifying the room’s emptiness. Through the window, outside, tall slim trees give the house a sense of scale and location — it is easy to imagine that this is an outsize property in an area far from where everyday people live.

headline.main: Gillian Laub’s Divided House Is Still Standing. What About Yours?
headline.print_headline: The Family Ties That Can Choke
